Alaris.Irc.CtcpSender

Alaris.Irc.CtcpSender Class Reference

This class allows the client to send CTCP commands. There is no limit on what commands can actually be sent, however, the accepted CTCP commands are: UserInfo, Finger, Version, Source, ClientInfo, ErrMsg, and Time. More...

Inherits Alaris::Irc::CommandBuilder.

Detailed Description

This class allows the client to send CTCP commands. There is no limit on what commands can actually be sent, however, the accepted CTCP commands are: UserInfo, Finger, Version, Source, ClientInfo, ErrMsg, and Time.

Action, though it is also a CTCP command, is so common that it is handled by the normal sender class.

Member Function Documentation

void Alaris.Irc.CtcpSender.CtcpPingReply ( string  nick,
string  timestamp 
)

Send back a timestamp so the requester can calculate his ping to this client.

Parameters:
nick The target's nick name.
timestamp The timestamp sent by the requester.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is invalid or the timestamp is empty.

CtcpListener.OnCtcpPingReply

void Alaris.Irc.CtcpSender.CtcpPingRequest ( string  nick,
string  timestamp 
)

Send a CTCP Ping request to another user.

The target may also respond with an error or nothing at all if it cannot or does not want to answer.

Parameters:
nick The target's nick name.
timestamp The timestamp to send to the target user. These can be generated by Thresher (CtcpUtil.CreateTimestamp) or by the client application.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is invalid.

CtcpListener.OnCtcpPingRequest

void Alaris.Irc.CtcpSender.CtcpReply ( string  command,
string  nick,
string  reply 
)

Send a reply in response to a CTCP request. Replies that exceed the IRC max length will be truncated.

Parameters:
nick The target's nick name.
command The CTCP command. Should be a string constant from CtcpUtil.
reply The text of the response.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is invalid, the command is empty, or the reply is empty.

The target may also respond with an error or nothing at all if it cannot or does not want to answer.

Parameters:

command The CTCP command. Should be a string constant from CtcpUtil.
Exceptions:
